alert.note: Alert for Bath; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:21PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, Montgomery, west central Morgan, Bath, Estill, Menifee, northern Lee, southeastern Fleming, southwestern Rowan and Wolfe Counties through 100 PM EST... At 1220 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wades Mill to Locust Branch. Movement was northeast at 85 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Sterling, Stoops, Ewington, Flat Creek, Judy, Stepstone, Howards Mill, Gatewoods Station, Coons Station and Grassy Lick around 1225 PM EST. Owingsville, Fitchburg, Cobhill, Craigs, Crystal, Cottage Furnace, Bourbon Furnace, Kendall Springs, Old Landing and Pinnacle around 1230 PM EST. Marshall, Pilot, Rogers Chapel, See, Patsey, Furnace, Slate Valley, Knowlton, Standing Rock and Peasticks around 1235 PM EST. Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Haystack, Slade, Red River Gorge, Koomer Ridge Campground, Natural Bridge S.P., Nada, Jenson, Glencairn and Sharkey around 1240 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Frenchburg, Pomeroyton, Stoll, Mariba, Denniston, Valeria, Maytown, Cranston, Tabor, Gosneyville, Wellington, Artville, Korea, Dan, Ezel, Big Woods, Scranton and Bangor. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 13 and 49. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for southeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Powell; Rowan; Wolfe
